ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a very interesting class, and important if you are thinking about doing anything conservation or development related. Prof. Carpenter is great, and the readings are manageable.
I'd recommend it with the caveat that they understand the place it plays in FES curriculum - especially for people from other parts of the university.

The class offers a great introduction and overview to key literature on conservation and development. It provides the necessary foundation for students interested in pursuing developmental professional work.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course was really helpful for thinking about my own research in anthropological terms, and contributed a lot to the writing of my senior essay. I'm really glad I took it, because it really helped me to develop my thinking about my subject.
